message.content: We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The patient presents with positive symptoms like delusions and lack of expression, as well as negative symptoms like lack of interest in socializing and maintaining employment. The duration of his symptoms suggests a diagnosis of schizophrenia. The negative urine drug screen rules out drug-induced psychosis. Schizotypal personality disorder and schizoid personality disorder do not typically involve delusions. Schizoaffective disorder involves both mood symptoms and psychotic symptoms, which are not present in this case.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The patient is exhibiting symptoms of delusions, lack of expression, and disinterest in socializing, among others. These are classic symptoms of schizophrenia. The negative drug screen rules out drugs as a cause of the symptoms.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The patient exhibits symptoms of psychosis, including delusions and lack of interest in socializing. The absence of any positive urine drug screen makes the diagnosis of substance-induced psychosis less likely. The duration of the symptoms over the past year suggests a diagnosis of schizophrenia. Schizoaffective disorder involves both psychotic symptoms and mood episodes, whereas schizotypal and schizoid personality disorders do not involve psychosis.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The patient exhibits symptoms of schizophrenia, including delusions, lack of expressiveness, and lack of interest in socializing. None of the other options fully capture the patient’s symptoms. The negative drug screen helps rule out drug-induced psychosis as the cause of the symptoms.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The patient is exhibiting symptoms of schizophrenia, including delusions and lack of interest in socializing. This is supported by the negative results from the urine drug screen, which rules out substance-induced psychosis. Schizotypal personality disorder and schizoid personality disorder involve different symptoms, while schizoaffective disorder involves both psychotic and mood symptoms.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The patient is exhibiting symptoms of psychosis, including delusions and lack of expression. The duration of symptoms and lack of improvement without medication suggests a diagnosis of schizophrenia. The negative urine drug screen rules out drug-induced psychosis.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The patient displays symptoms of delusions, lack of expression, and lack of interest in socializing which are characteristic of schizophrenia. The negative urine drug screen supports this diagnosis as drug-induced psychosis can sometimes present with similar symptoms. Schizoid personality disorder involves detachment and social withdrawal, but not delusions, while schizotypal and schizoaffective disorders have a different constellation of symptoms.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The patient is exhibiting symptoms of schizophrenia, including delusions, lack of socializing, and poor eye contact. Additionally, the negative urine drug screen rules out drug-induced psychosis. Schizophrenia is a severe mental disorder that requires long-term treatment and management.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The patient's symptoms of delusions, lack of expression, and lack of interest in socializing, as well as the negative urine drug screen, suggest a diagnosis of schizophrenia. Schizotypal personality disorder and schizoid personality disorder may have some similar symptoms but do not include delusions. Schizoaffective disorder includes mood disturbances as well as psychotic symptoms, which are not present in this case.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The patient exhibits schizophrenic symptoms, such as delusions and lack of socialization. The negative urine drug screen rules out substance-induced psychosis. Schizoaffective disorder includes symptoms of schizophrenia and mood disorder, which the patient does not exhibit. Schizoid and schizotypal personality disorders do not have the characteristic symptoms of delusions and hallucinations. Thus, the correct diagnosis is schizophrenia.
